data.title: CHOOSE ME / REMEMBER MY NAME
data.text:
Aero Theatre | Introduction and Q&A with filmmaker Alan Rudolph and producer Carolyn Pfeiffer. Moderated by Larry Karaszewski.

Book signing with Carolyn Pfeiffer for her new memoir, Chasing the Panther: Adventures and Misadventures of a Cinematic Life, prior to the screening at 6:30pm at the Aero Theatre, in partnership with the Larry Edmunds Bookshop

‘American Independents: A Special Weekend with Alan Rudolph and Carolyn Pfeiffer’

ABOUT THE FILMS:

CHOOSE ME, 1984, Dir: Alan Rudolph, 114 Minutes, Park Circus, USA.

A multi-layered, romantic comedy filled with intriguing characters interacting within a film noir web of coincidence, spontaneity, and unpredictability set to the jazz sound of Teddy Pendergrass. Alan Rudolph regulars Keith Carradine and Geneviève Bujold star alongside Lesley Ann Warren in this tale of loves lost and found.

FORMAT: 35mm

REMEMBER MY NAME, 1978, Dir: Alan Rudolph, 95 Minutes, Sony Pictures Entertainment, USA.

Hell hath no fury… like Geraldine Chaplin. Neil and Barbara Curry (Anthony Perkins and Berry Berenson) are enjoying a peaceful life in California when Neil’s ex-wife (Chaplin) is released from a 12-year stretch in prison for the murder of his previous mistress. Produced by Robert Altman, with cinematography by Tak Fujimoto.

FORMAT: 35mm
